title: Nocona Airport
text:
Nocona Airport was a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located one <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a> (2 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Nocona%2C%20Texas">Nocona</a>, a city in <a href="Montague%20County%2C%20Texas">Montague County, Texas</a>, United States. It was owned by the City of Nocona.
Facilities and aircraft.
Nocona Airport covered an area of 68 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (28 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 905 feet (276 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It had one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 14/32 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,200 by 50 feet (975 x 15 m).
For the 12-month period ending August 4, 2004, the airport had 100 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations.
